thread.title: Dixon Group snaps up another two pubs
thread.title_full: Dixon Group snaps up another two pubs

title: Dixon Group snaps up another two pubs
text:
The interior of the Newmarket Hotel, which is now in in the Dixon Group stable. Photo: Brook James Photographer
The expansive Dixon Hospitality Group has added another two venues to its growing pub business, taking control of the Middle Park and Newmarket hotels.
Former Spotless chief executive Bruce Dixon will step down this year from his top job at the cleaning and catering firm to help his son Mike grow his hospitality business.
The pair have since snapped up three venues in as many months.
The Newmarket and Middle Park pubs are their latest additions, closely following the May purchase of Albert Park's Vincent Hotel.
The fast-expanding pub group now has half a dozen leasehold hotels, including the Trading Wayside Inn, Station Hotel and the Hawksburn Hotel.
Mike Dixon said the group's "gastronomic" venues had a focus on quality food and functions.
The Newmarket in St Kilda, renovated by Six Degrees architects, retains its original facade while the Middle Park, a historic 1889 pub, boasts a 70-metre-long bar.
Mr Dixon would not be drawn on acquisition costs but said both pubs had more than 25 years on their leases and were bought at three-to-five times earnings.
The acquisitions were expected to completed by the end of September.
